metadata.Title: CVE-2020-16156 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
CPAN 2.28 allows Signature Verification Bypass.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16156` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libperl5.34 - 5.34.0-3ubuntu1.1
perl - 5.34.0-3ubuntu1.1
perl-base - 5.34.0-3ubuntu1.1
perl-debug - 5.34.0-3ubuntu1.1
perl-modules-5.34 - 5.34.0-3ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: rayveldkamp> Fix is in cpanpm 2.29 leosilva> using only ensured identified https mirrors could be a solution, as even perl modules if a trusted server is used its identity will be verified even in the absense of perl-module-signature.

criterions.comment: perl package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.34.0-3ubuntu1.1').
